title: Hello There...!
summary:
Another Composer Null picture! Various versions because even though the 
first and last ones match Null the best, being more dark than colourful 
or light, these other ones are really cool.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Composer Null in a glowing angel like form. They are white and blue/green shadows, with one arm raised up with their scarf wrapped around them. The black fragmented background with rainbow colours has dark speckles along the edges.

Digital art of Composer Null in a glowing angel like form. They are white and blue/green shadows, with one arm raised up with their scarf wrapped around them. The black fragmented background with rainbow colours has white speckles along the edges.

Digital art of Composer Null in a glowing angel like form. They are white and blue/green shadows, with one arm raised up with their scarf wrapped around them. The black fragmented background with rainbow colours has rainbow speckles along the edges.

Digital art of Composer Null in a glowing angel like form. They are greyscale, with one arm raised up with their scarf wrapped around them. The black fragmented background with rainbow colours has black speckles along the edges.

title: Null - Past Composer Sketch
summary: Just a drawing of Null from the past as a Composer before The Incident.
details:
I like the idea of their more abstract Noise form is a dark glowing tree 
with pale colours appearing between the "branches" and "roots". I don't 
know what sort of tree they would be when it's less abstract. I'm also 
thinking I might have them have a stained glass like tree could be the 
theme for their more abstract form. But I might want to save the stained
 glass for someone else? We'll see. Multiple beings could have a stained
 glass theme as well.

imgs.alt: Art of grinning masculine looking figure with glowing bandages swirl above their head like a halo. There are black and purple branching lines surrounding them, glowing white with a pale rainbow showing behind them.

title: It couldn’t happen to you
summary: Found an old Composer drawing and decided to finish it up a bit by adding the aura, the pulling away bits and a gradient. The “you” I think was supposed to refer to Hanekoma, but there’s nothing else in the file that answers that. This would have been based on the TWEWY Final Remix version.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Joshua from The World Ends with You. He's in his glowing white Composer form looking up in fear and horror. The text says "It couldn't happen to you".

title: Comforts for Father
summary:
In which Angels can imprint feelings on another. It’s not guaranteed to replace how the other was feeling before. One could force an override, but the results may not be healthy in the long term.

In this case, Mother is offering something soothing while she works. Father can accept or ignore it. It’s tied to her jacket since it’s not only her clothing but it's like part of her. He could wander off with it and still feel the calming effects for a quite a while as if she was still nearby.
details:
This was originally after the A Healthy Dose of Chaos AU and from a timeline where Father a) had a crush on Hanekoma and b) confesses to him and c) gets rejected. After the rejection he starts wearing a bear hat which is only brightly coloured because I don’t know what its design will be yet. The cyan would help remind me to deign it but...it could become the design.

I say it’s from almost from another timeline because I’m not as keen on Father having a crush on Hanekoma anymore, but I figured I should share it. When I originally posted this, I figured that this might be the first or one of the few times Mother has done something like this, which is why Father is surprised. Nowadays, i might still surprise him that people really do care about him.

imgs.alt: Digital art of the first comic panel of a woman dressed in white, called Mother, looking down at a man dressed in colourful clothing, called Father, laying dejected on the ground. Mother says "Such a state. Can you even move?" Father replies, "...Maybe."
Comic panel 2. Mother replies "Really." Father "hmphs" and rolls over to prove how down he really is.
Comic panel 3. Mother sits next to Father, floats her jacket off her shoulders and onto him. It glows comfortingly.
Comic panel 4. Mother starts reading through the papers she brought with her. Father looks over his shoulder at her in surprise.

Digital art of a comic of a woman dressed in white, called Mother, looking down at a man dressed in colourful clothing, called Father, laying dejected on the ground. Mother says "Such a state. Can you even move?" Father replies, "...Maybe." 

She replies "Really." Father "hmphs" and rolls over to prove how down he really is. Mother sits next to Father, floats her jacket off her shoulders and onto him. It glows comfortingly, and Mother starts reading through the papers she brought with her. Father looks over his shoulder at her in surprise.

title: Shibuya Fish Tank
summary: It’s unfinished so the title may not be clear, but imagine an animated version with the water rippling in the sky, the Composer’s attention being drawn away as if someone is calling him, and then vanishing, the ripples fading. All the while Shibuya’s people moving about, living their lives.

imgs.alt: Art of Shibuya's Scramble Crossing from The World Ends With You looking out towards the 109, 104 in this this world, building during the daytime. People in the city are generally represented are blue vertical blobs, but the four in the foreground are distinct. Orange hair, purple top, white shorts. Blonde hair, black beanie, white tank top, beige-yellow pants. Blonde hair, black beanie, coral sweater, white shorts. Black hair, green sweater, pale yellow skirt, black leggings. In the sky, there are ripples, and beyond them, watching down and much larger than any of the other buildings, is a white figure with wavey, barely shoulder length hair. His features are difficult to make out. He watches the humans down in the Scramble Crossing.

title: Father has an unhealthy obsession with cat shaped Souls
summary:
He may have discussed at great lengths the wondrous marvels of CAT’s work to Shibuya’s own Composer. He may have had juuust a slight influence on the development of the Mild and Wild Mews. He may have, once given a Mr. Mew cushion, happily carried it around and taken great delight in converting helping formless Angel Souls settle on a satisfactory form.

He may be likely to try out mannerisms of cat adjacent Souls, for better or for worse. But he never seems to want to appear like one and may be in denial about their influence.

imgs.alt: Digital art of a blonde long haired man in an orange/red/green/purple patterned coat with rainbow gloves happily holds a scruffy looking Mr. Mew cat doll to his chest. The Mr. Mew doll is wearing sunglasses and looks not amused.
Digital art of a glowing figure with long white hair and flaring coat holds up a black Mr. Mew cat cushion to a fiery orb of white. The glowing orb is surprised by the cushion.

Digital art of a glowing figure with long white hair and flaring coat holds up a black Mr. Mew cat cushion to a white glowing version of the cushion. The glowing figure is happy to see the cat shaped glowing figure.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Neku from the World Ends With You, from a Composer Neku AU. Composer Neku is in a gradient from blue to purple in the lightened Room of Reckoning. His face is blurred.
Digital art of Neku from the World Ends With You, Composer Neku AU. His face is not blurred.

title: PERCEIVE ME
summary: “We all perceive the world around us differently, filtered through the lens of our desired reality”
details:
"So if you’re wondering why a certain
 [someone] still looks [like that]… it’s because you refuse to perceive 
[them] as [they] really [are].
The only thing stopping you from seeing what [they] really [look] like…is you.
Let go of your preconceptions.
You only see what you want to see.
When you’re drowning in a sea of work with not enough time, why pour your 
soul into assets that get used all of… what, once? Really. Have some 
compassion."
Thank you Tin Pin Joshua! I find it
 amusing the extent they went through to not show Shiki’s face. It think
 it’s her eyes/eye colour that we’re missing? (Pre NEO.) And not really 
showing Joshua’s wings. (Which is new if you ignore DDD.) The Composer 
style too is sorta shown… we have blurry Composer to maybe show how 
Megumi perceives him, and then we get a glimpse at how Hanekoma sees 
him, but only the feet/lower legs which is more defined. It’s 
interesting.I think aside from possibly not “spoiling” stuff for 
NEO, Tin Pin Joshua sums it up nicely. Maybe they’re trying to stick to 
the original material - don’t show Shiki’s eyes and only give you bits 
of the Composer form.There’s a couple of variations cause I love 
chains & Composer imagery, even though that’s not the point here, 
and Shiki looked really plain without something compared to the Composer
 (so many effects!!) so a Mr. Mew pattern was the only thing I could 
think of that I could use to show obscuring Shiki’s identity.

imgs.alt: Art of Yoshiya Joshua Kiryu in his Composer form from The World Ends With You, with small angel wings and white paint crossing out his face with the words "PERCEIVE ME" in black/teal over it. His form is white and blurry with light blue shadows, based on animation's version. Chains appear in the foreground & background.

Art of the real Shiki Misaki from The World Ends With You, smiling with black paint crossing out her eyes with the words "PERCEIVE ME" in white over it. There are Mr. Mew - black cats - heads in the background with some layered over top of her.

title: Mr. Mew Expression Roulette

title: What A Wonder Fad That Would Be?
summary:
This was done before NEO so no worries about any NEO spoilers!

Brain: Hey you know who else has a Mr. Mew plush?
Me: Oh no??? (Oh yes?!)

An AU of the Producer Mr. Mew AU. No fic for this scene, but the general context can be found from the Curiosity Killed the Cat fanfic series on AO3 and by LetoLeGaosaure.
details: I used slight colouring to help differentiate the Mr. Mews. There’s no meaning behind them, other than giving Tsugumi’s a orange one to loosely tie to her skirt colour. I did try a red aura but it didn’t look good. Josh keeps the default blue from the game that I’ve been using. Played around with her aura too - it’s more curvy and flowy than Joshua’s just for something different. Meant to do this with other Composers I’ve drawn but forgot to keep it consistent with them.

imgs.alt: Digital comic of Composer Joshua and Composer Tsugumi meeting up. They introduce their own Producers to one another, who are both using Mr. Mew bodies. Tsugumi wonders if it's a fad, and Joshua is not a fan.

Comic page 2 of 2 of Shiki and Neku's reunion. Shiki wonders where Mr. Mew went & Neku says he's probably watching over her like a guardian angel. Joshua from atop 104 remarks how perceptive Neku is. Mr Mew stands besides Joshua.

title: It’s going to be a zetta fun time, Feathers!
summary: Composer Sho Minamimoto AU!You want a Composer who’s not afraid to mess around with UG? The Higher Plane? Fascinated by the Higher Plane? Yoooou got it!
details:
Initial thought is he may have messed the UG up with just a liiiittle bit of Taboo in order to become the Composer so he had a lot to recreate/rewrite/fix up/whatever and may have made it harder for the HP to access Shibuya’s UG when he was done. It’s fine. I’m sure They found it interesting and learned a lot about it afterwards.

I don’t have any major plans for a Composer Sho AU but hey if Hanekoma is looking to break (out of) the Higher Plane, this might be the Composer to do it, provided Sho can be a passable Composer for his UG duties in the meantime. Maybe over time grows to enjoy and excel at it too. I feel like he could toe the line between messing with the HP but not enough for the HP to get rid of him, since he’s had to put up with Officer duties before, Sho knows how to balance that out. Sho would also be fascinated with the HP and might even “work with” Them more than Composers normally would and that could a point in his favour for having the HP risk keeping him around. (What is normal anyways.)

Sho probably wouldn’t call Hanekoma “Feathers”, but what if similar to Megs for Megumi, he takes the “Hane” of “Hanekoma” which can mean “feather” and uses that as a nickname? I like the nickname but I can’t think of anyone but Sho would use that. Maybe Composer!Beat, if spun in positively?

The orange gradient is to make him similar to the HP colour scheme I use, since I feel like he would interested in Them. He leans towards orange/yellows, while the HP is orange/red. Other options are deep blue/purple (but somehow different from Neku) or… black… which isn’t really an option. I guess I could make his colour subdued to show he’s not really great as a Composer in the UG sense? I dunno. Might still mess with his gradient.

imgs.alt: Composer Sho Minamimoto resting his elbow on Sanae Hanekoma's shoulder. Sho is reaching up with a grin and Hanekoma is looking away uncomfortably.

title: What if they were…Partners?
summary: Inspired by Necrology on AO3!
details: This went from “hey this is a super cool idea and maybe they became friends” to “oh wait if we include canon stuff… does Megumi not remember Joshua????” and then here was this comic! Also thought that this is another reason why Joshua gave Megumi a chance to fix Shibuya because he wanted to trust his old partner one last time. Lots to play around with in this AU.

imgs.alt: Joshua celebrates Megumi and him winning the Reapers Game and becoming the Conductor and Composer, but slowly realizes that Megumi doesn't remember who Joshua is. It concerns Joshua.

It had taken Joshua by surprise that Megumi had offered to help before he had asked. But now, with Megumi treating him not only as a stranger, but as someone far him, it breaks Joshua's heart and his hand trembles.
It had taken Joshua by surprise that Megumi had offered to help before he had asked. But now, with Megumi treating him not only as a stranger, but as someone far him, it breaks Joshua's heart.

title: “Said you wanted to watch CAT work?”
summary: Short little comic that happens right before this. Longer version might exist someday but I wanted to do something simple.
details: These are screenshot “redraws” from episodes 5 and 6 of the anime, just taken a liiiiiittle bit out of context. See below.

imgs.alt: Art of Hanekoma asking "You said you wantted to watch CAT work?" and Neku responds with "Huh?"

title: Hobbies are important to have, Phones.
summary:
Composer Neku AU: Even though you can’t do your hobbies like you wish you could, they’re still important to have.

First one is cropped to better show that the borders are based on the TWEWY in game borders but thought I should share the extra border parts too.
details:
Basically Hanekoma convinces Neku to have a hobby and Neku likes CAT’s style, so why not try out CAT’s style?

Think I want this Neku to not have any or very little art experience. Neku picks it up rather quickly which could be a mix of natural talent, but also the Composer’s ability to just absorb knowledge from humans in Shibuya. Of course, knowledge is not the same as talent or skill, so you still have to practice it to get better, and what better way than it practice it in RG! Might cover that point in a comic.

I think Neku would have been interested in music, but being the Composer it’s just a Bit Too Much so he’s focusing on visual arts.

The holding multiple brushes is something we did in art classes. I don’t remember what it was called but something like a brush claw grip? Seemed extra appropriate for CAT.

Graffiti notes:

  • The graffiti is meant to cover the black TWEWY frame border area
  • Bottom left purple skull is Neku’s first(?) actual looking skull! I’m so proud of him
  • Fishy at the bottom is based on the old DGP fish (and me maybe misinterpreting part of CAT’s graffiti). RIP fishes you were neat
  • Light blue symbol in the bottom right was might be the new CAT Skull for Neku’s Game. Was going to be until I made super fiery and divided it up. If the player pin has been updated for NEO is what I think it is, it’s more aquatic now, which I associate with Joshua, so I would want to make Neku’s a little more fiery.
  • Right is the leopard from the CAT mural going to the RoR
  • Top left is a bird based on the “Angel” design in the RoR
  • The square shaped writing along the top is pulled from the NEO trailer. If it doesn’t end up being HP related that’s fine, but I’m using it for the time being

NEW - 2024/10/21: Ok, I don't want to delve into NEO content since I want to keep this as it was originally, but huh. If you know you know! I might make a separate post about those things but I've been meaning to since the end of the Animation and NEO and...it...hasn't happened yet.

imgs.alt: Digital art of a younger looking Neku Sakuraba paints a line with a paintbrush in front of him while looking up at Sanae Hanekoma. Both are holding many paint brushes and have paint all over them. They are surrounded by a painted border.

title: Not Your Joshua
summary:
One World's Joshua meets Another World's Composer Neku.
Another World's Joshua is not the same as This World's.
details: OG Notes: Composer Neku AU: Would happen after their initial meeting and before the visit to Neku’s DGP. Had this part in my mind for a while but wasn’t sure about the specific lead up and follow up so I finally decided to go ahead and make this anyways. Can always slot it into something longer later.

imgs.alt: Comic of Neku Sakuraba and Yoshiya Joshua Kiryu from The World Ends With You. Neku, in his glowing white Composer form, yells at Joshua. Joshua transforms into his own Composer form, with the words, "DO NOT MISTAKE ME FOR YOUR JOSHUA".

title: The Composer is very expressive too! Probably?
summary: TWEWY Animation styled based on the game sprite with some minor effects from the secret ending. Based off of Joshua's expression sheet.

imgs.alt: Art of eight blurry faces of Yoshiya Joshua Kiryu in his Composer form from The World Ends With You. From top left to right, top to bottom row, the expressions are: 3/4 looking anxious, from above looking determined, looking shy/uneasy, side view and annoyed, determined and shouting, from below looking anxious and yelling, side view looking smug, and then looking amused and looking to the side.

title: Possession
summary:
Ever think about the natural state of the Higher Plane? How the UG could become like that?
Remember Kitaniji’s plan for saving Shibuya?
Ever wonder about those chains next the throne?
What if some Angels got…impatient?

Design choices and thoughts about the power balance between the Composer, Producer and Higher Plane below.
details:
The ID for the Producer in charge would allow Them to override the Composer’s control. Might not be necessary depending on the power gap between the two in the UG but this method would be a guaranteed way to take over. The idea would be for emergencies, which is why Producers would be carefully chosen from the HP to make the proper judgement. I kept Hanekoma’s ID as his wristwatch and made the possessing Angel’s ID as earrings, mostly to keep it simple and easily visible. They need Hanekoma’s ID for the plan since he’s the Producer so They’re using him, making both IDs visible. I like to think the RoR is designed by the HP so with permission anyone from the HP could hijack the District.

The symbol at the bottom page 1 is based on a cat skull (but not a stylized CAT skull which I thought about using later, whoops) with a “web of bones and a hint of skulls”. I had this style in mind for other HP ideas but they’re on hold now so I’m bringing that here cause it’s a lot of fun to play around with. (If you ever stared at the bridge above the Shibuya River you might be able to make out the influence! Well and CAT’s art.)

The spreading floor pattern uses the same idea. It seemed like a cool way to visually show the Angel taking over. I was thinking They can just “attach” or “plug” themselves into the RoR like plugging cords in or something? Be able to naturally combine. Or maybe “weave” their wings into the “fabric of Shibuya” as how AD Joshua describes the RoR.

There was a thought about visually designing an Angel instead of using Hanekoma’s body (sequel I swear if we don’t get more Angels…) but I wasn’t in the mood for it. Hopefully with the idea of using IDs as described above and possession/using his form it doesn’t seem too odd to use Hanekoma.

And how does the HP feel about this? I like to believe They’re against this. Too much intervention, even if it works out. They’re divided on what They should do with this “lost” world. Do They descend and apprehend the Fallen Angels? (Was thinking there’s a small(?) group of them doing this.) Or do They sit back, observe and report to other worlds that aren’t a lost cause? And if it’s the second option, are there other Angels that oppose that and interfere? Maybe some Producers neighbouring Shibuya, perhaps?

“No one has ever accused Angels of being in a hurry.” Hah! We’ve got plenty of “Shibuya"s so let’s experiment! If we break one, we’ll just let the Composer fix it, since he loves Shibuya so, so much!

imgs.alt: The Composer greets a visitor who takes on Hanekoma's face and demands they show their true face instead.

The Composer flies up and away from the throne room chains and fire back white beams from above. The chains cut through the beams, bind the Composer, and bind him to the throne. The Angel smiles and the Composer glares back.
The Angel monologues as their wings merge into the floor and light up the room. They monologue at the Composer as they put him to sleep.

title: Chill Time - Watching CAT Work.
summary: Cleaned up stream drawing from 2020/01/02 and 2020/01/09.

imgs.alt: Art of Composer Neku watching in amazement as Sanae Hanekoma draws happily while they sit on a couch at night.

title: Hallucinations
summary:
Except the one time that it isn’t.

Composer Neku AU + parallel world cross over: Did you ever wonder why Neku threw fire at “Joshua” immediately on sight? Did you ever wonder if the last Neku saw of Joshua was him smiling on the ground might mess him up a little? (Or Joshua always smiling I suppose.) Well, now you know! Pages 1-3 can be considered part of the general Composer Neku AU, while Page 4 leads directly to this parallel world comic here that started it all.
details:
This idea came around the time I was creating the title/caption 
for “You’re Shibuya’s Composer now” comic. I was tempted to put “You’re 
Shibuya’s new Composer now, congratulations!” But that sounded 
too cruel and decided to call that the “Joshua voice”. Which, over time,
 actually became a Joshua voice which haunts Neku. I thought about how 
Neku might try to deal with these and decided, what about throwing fire 
at them? Like how he threw fire at “Joshua” when he first arrived. Why 
not combined the two? And here we are! I plan to expand more on this, so
 look forward to that! Also! You want another layer of imagined 
snarky Joshua voices? “You saved everyone (but me)” and “They have … 
second chance (but not me)”, with Neku adding the part in brackets. More
 Fun Thoughts as this AU continues!

imgs.alt: Comic page 1 of 4, of Neku Sakuraba as a Composer, talking to a glitching Joshua who vanishes when Neku touches him.
Comic page 2 of 4, of Neku Sakuraba as a Composer, talking to an older Joshua jokes that Neku should invite all his friends to a party. Neku shoots flames at Joshua.
Comic page 3 of 4, of Neku Sakuraba as a Composer, showing times he erased Joshua with flames.
Comic page 4 of 4, of Neku Sakuraba as a Composer, showing a fireball at a non-glitchy version of Joshua, which catches Neku's fireball instead of being hit by it.

title: Names
summary: Follows after 'Redecoration'. Neku understands the concept of parallel worlds but he’s struggling with separating the two “Joshua”s he has now met. “Kiryu” here, no matter how similar he can be to Neku’s “Joshua”, is not the same person and does not have the answers for “Joshua”.
details:
Originally Neku was going to be a bit more perceptive in that using last names is also easier for our Joshua with more exchange between them, but I wanted to keep this short and I’ll leave that for later when Neku is in a better mood and cares enough about our Joshua to pay attention and pick up on those details.

For Composer Neku AU topics, this was the last of the original ideas I had planned when I started this. There’s a couple more things I would like to add but the updates might not come out as quickly. But anything planned for Joshua and Neku will be more positive! Well, considering the circumstances. I promise this isn’t always a Sad Feels AU.

imgs.alt: Comic page 1 of 2 of Composer Neku and Joshua talking from the Composer Neku AU. Neku says "But you - Er, Joshua. Not you' Joshua but the one I -" Joshua cuts Neku off. "Enough. My name is Yoshiya Kiryu. You can call me Kiryu. That should avoid any confusion. Do you understand, Composer Sakuraba?"
Comic page 2 of 2 of Composer Neku and Joshua talking about how to address each other from the Composer Neku AU. Neku turns away and says "Last names, huh? Fine then, Kiryu."
Art of Yoshiya Joshua Kiryu from The World Ends With You putting an angel feather in his hair. The feather is glowing. Joshua is wearing a spider lily patterned jacket.

title: Higher Plane Experimentation - The Beginning
summary: Experimenting with Higher Plane colours and visual effects. Colour scheme choices and other HP thoughts below.
details:
I’m planning to use anything HP related for playing around with styles and designs and I want to experiment with, all which is probably the opposite direction of we’ll maybe get one day. Mainly this is using stronger contrasts with light and shadow and leaning into the more formal and scientific tone of the secret reports.

I wanted red tinged shadows for whatever colour scheme I settled on which seems to be autumn or amber. I chose darker tones to contrast with the imagery of “Angels”, “Ascending”, “Higher Plane”, etc.. Maybe it was once bright and vibrant but over time it slowly shifted to something darker and dimmer. Without planning it, this reminds me the dim Room of Reckoning and I wonder if shifts similarly based on the UG/Composer…or if it’s also strongly connected to the HP.

In addition to the colour scheme, the edges of perception are darker/less defined. I like the style on it’s own but with TWEWY’s style it’s another variation of the streaky borders. I’ve played around a bit before with using TWEWY borders as a way to show separation of planes/perception and I might start leaning into it more.

Clothing/accessory wise I wanted change Hanekoma’s sunglasses to glasses and shift his clothes into something lab coat or formal like. And maybe do something with his watch. But he’ll keep his sandals. Those are non-negotiable.

“Location” wise I was hung up on them living “above” and separated from the UG and RG. Something foreign, formless and/or loosely defined. But for now…why not just toss them on the same “level” as the RG and UG? They can have their own HP only locations and spaces but for part of it…I’m just going to layer it right on top.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You standing in Shibuya's Scramble Crossing. The man it glitching out and is surrounded by glowing human beings. Some have Reaper wings and some do not.

Digital Art of Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You wearing a shiny white dress shirt and labcoat with cloud like wings. Light comes down from above, almost looking like it's coming from above a water's surface, as if he's underwater.
Digital art of Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You drawn in a warm and fiery coloured style. His wings have soft and undefined edges and his long coat breaks off into falling pieces.

title: Redecoration
summary:
The Dead God’s Pad has been redesigned and Joshua plays nice with the Composer of this world. Neku learns this Joshua isn’t the one he knew that didn’t mysteriously 
come back, and very much does not want to deal with any Joshua.
details:
Original Notes.

I think the pad could be a mix of both the Composer and the Conductor’s design, and maybe a bit of the GMs? Like others can bring stuff in but it’s ultimately the Composer’s say whether something stays or not? I always felt Joshua’s pad was weird so I wondered if maybe it was a joint thing?

Josh sinking into the couch was entirely for fun but as I thought about it, Neku can probably alter his environment which can result in exactly this situation. (Or the couch sinks more than you expect it to, as they do)We really don’t know what Joshua is like outside of week 2 so I thought I’d play with that. He’s trying not to antagonize this world’s Composer, and while it’s not shown here, I think Neku would ignore and/or get extremely annoyed if Joshua reminded him of week 2 Joshua. Anyways, I mostly wanted to see a relaxed Joshua who’s not trying to overly antagonize Neku, but he still keeps this world’s Composer’s issues in mind.

Style wise I think I’ll use gradients give the Composers some colour but to also indicate the influence/authority(?) the Composer has at the time. I’ve considered their glow and auras to help indicate this but I only played with the glow here. Joshua being glowy on the first page was done before I thought of this and and I kept it entirely because of I really liked how it lookedI 1000% made up the special noise thing.

Just thought it would be neat if something threatening was lurking in the aquarium floors/walls

imgs.alt: Comic page 1 of 3 of Composer Neku showing a parallel world Joshua his space themed Dead God's Pad from the Composer Neku AU. Joshua's thoughts: "Cold, empty, isolated. The emotions invoked by the design is intriguing, but... When it's clearly a reflection of the Composer..."

Comic page 2 of 3 of Composer Neku showing a parallel world Joshua his Dead God's Pad. Joshua comments "This room feels boundless. I've never seen anything like it before. A few more furnishings would really tie the room together." Neku halfheartedly agrees. Joshua continues to try to start a conversation, " Well then, I'll just make myself comfortable." 

Joshua goes to sit down and Neku says "Go ahead" as Joshua sinks too far into the couch, making Neku laugh. Joshua looks at the laughing Neku who then suddenly stops and turns away from Joshua who smiles and thinks this is "Good."

Comic page 3 of 3 of Composer Neku showing a parallel world Joshua his Dead God's Pad. Joshua says "With some refinement your couches would be just fine." Neku bites back, " Better than the old couches. They sucked. Really ugly and uncomfortable."

Joshua asks, "Is that so? You redecorated because of the couches?" and Neku explains, "No...it was the creepy fish. If they didn't follow you around...And ram into the glass like you were their last meal it would be...fine. But then after I...I noticed a new kind of Noise. It usually stayed way below the surface but sometimes it would come up for a moment. It was freaky."

Joshua comments, "Hmm, sounds like you removed some special security. Unique Noise that can approach undetected? It's a fun way to eliminate unwanted...Visitors." Neku exclaims, "Y-you're not serious? That's crazy!"

Joshua continues. "Who can say? But it sounds like I don't have to worry about any surprises here. No alien Noise or the like?" Neku jokes back, "Don't tempt me..."

title: Home
summary:
Lonely thoughts they seep, into mind

Into me, pushing deep

Wash the dirt, a hard days work

Know my place

On my own

No poison in my bones

On my own

This is where I build my home

My home,

this will always be my home

I need someone, to hold

My home

This will always be my home

Home - Ellie Goulding

I had a vague comic mind for this song but I didn’t really know what to do for it, so I touched up a piece playing with the Room of Reckoning that’s related in case I don’t get around to it.

imgs.alt: Zoomed out art of the Composer sitting slumped over on his throne in the Room of Reckoning.  TWEWY's Shibuya's 104 crossing can be seen through the floor.
Zoomed in art of the Composer sitting slumped over on his throne in the Room of Reckoning.  TWEWY's Shibuya's 104 crossing can be seen through the floor.

title: Take my hand and let’s listen to the Music

imgs.alt: The Composer and Megumi Kitaniji from The World Ends With You. The Composer spreads his arms wide and smiles, taking in the city. He turns towards Kitaniji and holds out a hand to him. Kitaniji takes the Composer's hand and glows.

title: For You
summary:
Just wanted to surprise Joshua with a gift he wasn’t expecting. So…maybe
 an Angel Feather? If this were to continue I imagine Joshua would try 
to play it cool but is actually really touched that he’s receiving something that maybe he shouldn’t have.

Joshua’s jacket is inspired by PagongKyoto’s Rangiku Men’s Jacket. It 
has a nifty pattern that…well, if they aren’t spider lilies, it looks 
like it to me

imgs.alt: Art of Yoshiya Joshua Kiryu and Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You. Joshua is handed a glowing. semi-transparent feather, who is wearing a spider lily jacket. Joshua is surprised as he accepts it. Hanekoma is wearing a light tan jacket and is smiling warmly.

title: Don't
summary: Played around with adding stars/particles to his aura when adding color.Also...don't cross Composer Neku. Very spiky.

imgs.alt: Art of 3 Composer Nekus with his bright form turning very spiky with sparkles. The left one is a bight purple-blue vivid colour. The middle is a less purple-blue colour. The right most one is more blue.

title: I’m here for you too.
summary:
Really I just wanted to have Neku give Hanekoma a hug but then a comic 
happened. Maybe with more dialogue than necessary. Some Composer Neku AU
 context below.
details:
• This would be like a second half/mirroring a conversation about Hanekoma being there for Neku and how they need to open and honest with each other
  • Neku knows what Hanekoma did during the Game (whether Hanekoma confessed on his own or Neku figured out he was hiding something and prodded him about it) but the Higher Plane hasn’t done anything or don’t know about Hanekoma yet…I think is where I want to go with this? Point is Neku knows that there’s a chance they might take him away, permanently or temporarily, or something, and maybe without warning
  • Joshua is a touchy subject for them both. Hanekoma is pretty good about Joshua being brought up, but for Neku it’s entirely dependent on his mood. It’s gotten easier for Neku as time passes but it’s not easy
  • Working on it made me think about how this AU would be a neat way to explore how Neku and Hanekoma would develop and move on from their losses. Something to think about/revisit

imgs.alt: Comic of Composer Neku appearing in front of Hanekoma, startling him and he drops his phone. Neku picks it up and sees a photo of Joshua.
Comic of Hanekoma trying to deflect the pain he's feeling, and Neku tries to comfort him.
Comic of Neku giving Hanekoma a hug. Hanekoma returns it, thanking him.

title: I’m here for you
summary: Composer Neku's new support.

imgs.alt: Hanekoma hugs a crying Neku.

title: You’re Shibuya’s new Composer now.
summary: A TWEWY Bad End and the start of the Composer Neku AU.
details: There’s a variety of Nekus that would end up here but I decided to go with one that didn’t want to but that felt he had to. While I enjoy this kind of Neku I think a one that is extremely done with Joshua would also be fun to explore since I think it would still be rough since the details of being a Composer still wouldn’t be known ahead of time.

imgs.alt: Comic of Neku shooting Joshua from The World Ends With You. Neku opens his eyes wide after his gunshot hits Joshua, triggering the Reapers Game symbol to rise from his body in a bright, glowing white symbol. Joshua's glowing, glitching body falls to the floor and Neku reaches out, crying, and calling Joshua's name.

A comic of Neku trying to get close to Joshua's fading and glitching body - looking older and faintly smiling. Hanekoma, with white wings spread wide, stops Neku and tells him, "What's done is done. There's no turning back."

title: Ya did what you had to, Phones.
summary: More Composer Neku AU! They wouldn’t be allowed to keep all their memories of the Game and Neku, right? Fragments would be okay, to make it feel like it was a dream, but not all of them I would think.
details: Since Shiki and Beat were Neku’s partners, I think it would be hard for Neku to remove their memories of him/the Game all at once. He could probably remove a good chunk of them initially and then slowly erase the remaining pieces over time…like how memories can naturally fade away.
characters: Neku, Hanekoma, Shiki, Eri, Beat, Rhyme

imgs.alt: Page 1 of a comic of Composer Neku Sakuraba and Sanae Hanekoma sitting and talking on the edge of a building. Hanekoma tells Neku that he did it - their world is safe now. Beat and Rhyme walk in separate directions from Shiki and Eri in a crowd of people.

Page 2 of a comic. Eri and Rhyme ask Shiki and Beat separately about a they can't remeber from their dreams. Hanekom looks to Neku as he talks about what he did - taking their memories and changing them. Hanekoma places a hand on Neku's shoulder.

thumbnailAlt: Hanekoma puts a hand on Neku's shoulder.

title: Mentor Joshua Kiryu? Mentor Joshua Kiryu!
summary:
Since our/TWEWY Joshua is stuck in a Composer Neku parallel world for
 a couple days….might as well act as a mentor for the new Composer?This builds off of this comic here but skips a couple plot points that I might get around to one day. See below if you want those details.
details:
After meeting parallel world Composer Neku, Joshua tells him that no,
 he’s not the Joshua that Neku knew, it’s called parallel worlds, and 
no, he can’t answer the questions Neku has about what his Joshua did 
(even though he can guess he’s absolutely not sharing those speculations
 with the state Neku is in).To help Neku with the parallel world 
concept, Joshua offers to tune up to his Composer form so he will look 
less like the Joshua Neku knew. He also offers Neku his knowledge of 
Composer things, whatever overlap their worlds may have (which is like 
all of it except whatever rules Neku decided to change…something I 
remembered he can do), since Neku is oddly lacking in Composer 
knowledge.Joshua only does this to help pass time and to keep 
Neku sane, cause if the Composer becomes more unstable, then so does the
 world, meaning Joshua’s chances of surviving go down. Yep, that’s the 
only reason.But if this seems too happy then consider: Why is 
Joshua the one mentoring Neku? I would think that’s the Producer’s job. 
So…where is Neku’s Producer? Maybe we’ll get there one day and that’s if
 I even if I decide to do something different with this parallel world’s
 Producer cause doesn’t that mean we have multiple fallen angels? How 
does that work…?

imgs.alt: Composer Neku AU, with Composer Joshua Kiryu showing Composer Neku music.

thumbnailAlt: Thumbnail of Composer Neku AU, with Composer Joshua Kiryu showing Composer Neku music.

title: Composer Neku's RG Appearance
summary: How many years would Neku lose in appearance if he tuned down to the RG?
details: I don’t have any redesign ideas other than changing Neku’s turtleneck to a hoodie and giving him a blue theme and putting a star pattern on his hoodie. Which is fine because I think whatever I do for this AU I would probably keep Neku in his Composer state since it is a Composer Neku AU. There’s probably a middle form without the Composer effects but sticking to these two forms makes it pretty clear Neku is the Composer.

imgs.alt: Art of Neku from The World Ends With You, showing him in his glowing, white Composer form at "UG Full Vibe Frequency", and his new RG form, "Down Tuned", where Neku looks like a young child.
Art of Neku Sakuraba and Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You. Neku appears as a child in a starry lined hoodie, standing next to Hanekoma.

thumbnailAlt: Composer Neku in young human form.

title: Life’s little crossroads are often as simple as the pull of a trigger.
summary: Visiting a world with a TWEWY Bad End.
details:
Our main game Joshua hops to a parallel world and meets a Neku who did take the shot…and now this Composer Neku is about to get a lesson on parallel worlds. Why doesn’t he know about them already? Maybe there’s enough on his plate being a new Composer and having Shibuya handed off to him in a poor state…and his own mental state isn’t great. Or maybe he does know and he’s in denial that his world’s Joshua isn’t actually gone… Something like that.

The Composer form changing colours makes it more fun to draw. What Joshua summons are intended to be something like (dragon) claw noise(?). It catches the fire like when he caught the bullets in the RG. Just something to play with it. (And it looks pretty)

imgs.alt: Joshua from The World Ends With You examines the Room of Reckoning and a glowing fiery figure appears from behind him, throwing a fireball at him. Joshua catches it with a purple claw/flower like summon.

Joshua tries to reassure the attacking Composer but the Composer yells back at Joshua, angry that Joshua is here. The Composer explains that he erased Joshua last Game, and his appearance becomes more clear and is revealed to be Neku Sakuraba.

title: We did it!
summary: It’s the Final TWEWY Redraw! These have been a lot of fun for trying new things and experimenting.

imgs.alt: Digital art of a group of people giving a high five. Neku Sakuraba, Shiki Misaki, Beat Bito and Rhyme Bito are celebrating in front of The World Ends With You's 104 building during a sunset.
Digital art of a group of people giving a high five. Neku Sakuraba, Shiki Misaki, Beat Bito and Rhyme Bito are celebrating in front of The World Ends With You's 104 building during daytime.

title: Guardians
summary:
“Ready, Sanae?”

“Right behind you, Josh”

Better hope you’re on their side.
details: I’ve been wanting to do something with them being Guardians. I think it would be really interesting to see if something was threatening enough to their home they would have to step in to protect it. And maybe breaking or bending some rules to do so cause that’s always fun.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Joshua and Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You as they dive from a starry night sky into a sunny sky. Joshua is glowing and has his human self deform and Hanekoma is glowing bright with angel wings.

A bordered and close up version of Joshua and Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You as they dive from a starry night sky into a sunny sky. Joshua is glowing and has his human self deform and Hanekoma is glowing bright with angel wings.

title: Josh, wait.
summary: Hanekoma sees something Joshua can't.
details: It was definitely about me playing around with Angels having their eyes and Accessory Of Choice light up when they need to raise their senses - say, if an Angel came down that was "invisible" to the Composer. And it was another early-ish example of higher frequency folks breaking rules with the border.

imgs.alt: Yoshiya Joshua Kiryu and Sanae Hanekoma from The World Ends With You at sunset. Joshua is mid gesture when Hanekoma places a hand on his shoulder, gently pulling him back. Hanekoma looks dead ahead with a serious and slightly displeased expression. His eyes and writstwatch glow yellow-orange and the top of his hair goes over the top border.

title: I Caught Your Reflection
summary:
I caught your reflection
In the neon on glass
An electric silhouette
Against a static sky 

When Is the Future - VNV Nation

When I heard these lines I had a really, really vague idea of what I wanted to draw but no idea what it should actually look like. This isn’t quite what I had in mind but it’s the right direction.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Neku seeing Joshua's reflection in a crowd from The World Ends With You. Joshua is not in the crowd of people, only in the reflection of the shop window.
Close up of Neku seeing Joshua's reflection in a crowd from The World Ends With You. Joshua is not in the crowd of people, only in the reflection of the shop window.

Art of the Composer from The World Ends With You. He's glowing in grayscale, head tilted up and looking down at the viewer with fury in his eyes.

Digital art of Joshua holding Hanekoma from The World Ends WIth You. Joshua in his Composer form is holding a fading red half of the Panthera Cantus. The Composer is gradient colored from yellow to purple.
